content: frankie s knitted stuff mistake rib tea cosy by varying the size of the needles and yarn used this simple tea cosy can be knitted to fit two sizes of teapot use dk weight for a three cup one pint teapot and aran for a six cup or two pint pot yarn and needles the smaller cosy is knitted on 3 75 mm needles us size 5 and uses about 30g of dk weight yarn for the bigger size you will need 4 5 mm needles us size 7 and 40g of aran weight yarn gauge using the yarn and needles specified and working in k2 p2 rib aim for a gauge of roughly 12 sts and 16 row to 5 cm / 2 ² for the smaller size and 10 sts and 12 row for the bigger the samples were measured without stretching the rib having said that rib stretches so don t worry too much about getting exactly the same gauge - near enough is good enough the actual stitch used in this pattern is mistake rib a variation that happens when you try to knit k2 p2 rib on an odd number of stitches this gives a nice fabric that is mostly reversible more of that later 1 the knitting knit two identical pieces one for each side of the cosy using the long tail method cast on 31 stitches first two row *p2 k2 repeat from * to last 3 sts p2 k1 now for four row of increasing row 1 kf&b p1 k2 *p2 k2 repeat from * to last 3 sts p2 k1 32 sts row 2 kf&b p1 k2 *p2 k2 repeat from * to end 33 sts row 3 kf&b *p2 k2 repeat from * to end 34 sts row 4 kf&b *p2 k2 repeat from * to last st p1 35 sts work 30 row for the main part of the cosy every row *k2 p2 repeat from * to last 3 sts k2 p1 decreasing for the top a certain amount of blind following is needed for this trust me it will work out row 1 k2 p2 k1 p2tog p1 x 4 k2 p1 31 sts row 2 k2 p2 k1 p2 x 4 k2 p1 row 3 k2 p2 k1 p2tog x 4 k2 p1 27 sts row 4 k2 p1 k1 p2 x 4 k2 p1 row 5 k2 p2 k2tog x 4 k2 p1 23 sts row 6 k2 p3 x 4 k2 p1 row 7 k2 p2 k2tog k1 x 4 p1 19 sts row 8 *k2 p2 repeat from * to last 3 sts k2 p1 row 9 k2 p2tog x 4 k2 p1 15 sts row 10 *k2 p1 repeat from * to end 2 nearly there … row 11 *k1 p2tog repeat from * to end 10 sts row 12 *k1 p1 repeat from * to end cast off working in k1 p1 rib for a tea cosy that leaves the lid
